fields.title: Angelina Jolie
fields.content:
Date of Birth: June 4, 1975
Place of Birth: Los Angeles, California, USA
Occupation: Actress, Director, Producer, Humanitarian
Biography:
Angelina Jolie Voight was born into a family of actors; her mother, Marcheline Bertrand, was an actress, and her father, Jon Voight, is an Academy Award-winning actor. Jolie began acting at a young age, making her screen debut as a child alongside her father in "Lookin' to Get Out" (1982). She pursued a career in acting, studying at the Lee Strasberg Theatre Institute and later attending New York University.

Jolie's breakthrough role came in the television film "Gia" (1998), where she portrayed supermodel Gia Carangi, earning her critical acclaim and a Golden Globe Award. She continued to garner attention with her performances in "Girl, Interrupted" (1999), for which she won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress, and the "Lara Croft: Tomb Raider" series, establishing her as a major Hollywood star.

Aside from her acting career, Jolie is known for her humanitarian work. She became a Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in 2001 and has undertaken numerous field missions around the world. In recognition of her efforts, she was promoted to the rank of Special Envoy to the UNHCR in 2012.

Jolie has also directed and produced several films, including "In the Land of Blood and Honey" (2011), "Unbroken" (2014), and "First They Killed My Father" (2017). She continues to be an influential figure in both the entertainment industry and humanitarian efforts, advocating for various causes, including human rights and women's empowerment.

fields.title: Margot Robbie
fields.content:
Date of Birth: July 2, 1990
Place of Birth: Dalby, Queensland, Australia
Occupation: Actress, Producer
Biography:
Margot Elise Robbie was born in Dalby, Queensland, and raised on the Gold Coast. She moved to Melbourne in her late teens to pursue an acting career. Robbie began her career in Australian independent films and television series, notably starring in the soap opera "Neighbours" from 2008 to 2011. Her performance garnered attention and led to her casting in the American television series "Pan Am" (2011-2012).

Robbie's breakthrough role came in Martin Scorsese's "The Wolf of Wall Street" (2013), where she starred opposite Leonardo DiCaprio. Her portrayal of Naomi Lapaglia earned critical acclaim and put her on the map as one of Hollywood's most promising talents. Following this, she took on diverse roles in films such as "Focus" (2015), "The Legend of Tarzan" (2016), and "Suicide Squad" (2016), where her portrayal of Harley Quinn was particularly well-received.

In 2017, Robbie starred in and produced the biographical film "I, Tonya," portraying controversial figure skater Tonya Harding. Her performance earned her an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress and won her a Critics' Choice Award. She continued to demonstrate her range with roles in "Mary Queen of Scots" (2018), "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" (2019), and "Bombshell" (2019).

Robbie co-founded the production company LuckyChap Entertainment, which focuses on promoting female-centric films and talent. Under this banner, she has produced films like "Birds of Prey" (2020) and "Promising Young Woman" (2020). Known for her versatility and dedication, Robbie remains a prominent figure in contemporary cinema, both in front of and behind the camera.

fields.title: Julia Roberts
fields.content:
Date of Birth: October 28, 1967
Place of Birth: Smyrna, Georgia, USA
Occupation: Actress, Producer
Biography:
Julia Fiona Roberts was born in Smyrna, Georgia, to parents who were actors and playwrights. After her parents' divorce, she moved with her mother and siblings to Smyrna. Roberts aspired to become a veterinarian but later studied journalism before turning to acting. She moved to New York City after high school and signed with a modeling agency while also taking acting classes.

Roberts' first significant film role was in "Mystic Pizza" (1988), which led to her breakthrough in "Steel Magnolias" (1989), earning her an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress. She achieved global stardom with the romantic comedy "Pretty Woman" (1990), for which she received a Golden Globe Award and an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress.

Throughout the 1990s and 2000s, Roberts starred in numerous successful films, including "Sleeping with the Enemy" (1991), "My Best Friend's Wedding" (1997), "Runaway Bride" (1999), and "Erin Brockovich" (2000). Her role in "Erin Brockovich" earned her an Academy Award for Best Actress and cemented her status as one of Hollywood's leading actresses.

Roberts has continued to enjoy a successful career with notable performances in films such as "Ocean's Eleven" (2001), "Closer" (2004), "Eat Pray Love" (2010), and "Wonder" (2017). In addition to her acting career, she has also taken on roles as a producer, working on projects through her production company Red Om Films.

Known for her radiant smile and versatile talent, Roberts remains one of the most beloved and bankable stars in Hollywood. She has also been involved in various charitable endeavors, particularly focusing on children's health and education.

fields.title: Ryan Gosling
fields.content:
Date of Birth: November 12, 1980
Place of Birth: London, Ontario, Canada
Occupation: Actor, Musician, Producer
Biography:
Ryan Thomas Gosling was born in London, Ontario, and grew up in a family with a deep love for performing arts. He began his career as a child star on the Disney Channel's "The Mickey Mouse Club" (1993–1995) alongside future stars like Justin Timberlake and Britney Spears. Following his time on the show, Gosling appeared in various family entertainment programs, including "Goosebumps" and "Are You Afraid of the Dark?"

Gosling transitioned to more serious acting roles in the early 2000s, gaining critical acclaim for his performance in "The Believer" (2001). He continued to build his reputation with roles in "Murder by Numbers" (2002) and "The United States of Leland" (2003). His breakthrough came with the romantic drama "The Notebook" (2004), where his portrayal of Noah Calhoun won him widespread recognition and established him as a leading man.

Throughout his career, Gosling has taken on a variety of challenging roles in films such as "Half Nelson" (2006), for which he received an Academy Award nomination, "Lars and the Real Girl" (2007), "Blue Valentine" (2010), "Drive" (2011), and "The Ides of March" (2011). His performances have consistently earned him praise for his versatility and depth.

In addition to acting, Gosling is also a musician. He is a member of the band Dead Man's Bones, which released its debut album in 2009. He has also ventured into directing with the film "Lost River" (2014).

Gosling's recent work includes critically acclaimed films such as "La La Land" (2016), which won him a Golden Globe for Best Actor, and "Blade Runner 2049" (2017). He continues to be one of the most respected and sought-after actors in the industry.

fields.title: Ariana Grande
fields.content:
Date of Birth: June 26, 1993
Place of Birth: Boca Raton, Florida, USA
Occupation: Singer, Actress
Biography:
Ariana Grande-Butera was born in Boca Raton, Florida, and began her career in the Broadway musical "13" before landing the role of Cat Valentine on the Nickelodeon television series "Victorious" (2010–2013) and its spinoff "Sam & Cat" (2013–2014). Her talent for singing was evident from a young age, and she pursued a music career alongside her acting roles.

Grande's debut album, "Yours Truly" (2013), debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200, with the lead single "The Way" reaching the top ten of the Billboard Hot 100. Her second studio album, "My Everything" (2014), also topped the charts and included hit singles like "Problem" and "Bang Bang." Grande's powerful vocals and range have drawn comparisons to Mariah Carey.

She continued her success with subsequent albums "Dangerous Woman" (2016), "Sweetener" (2018), and "Thank U, Next" (2019). "Sweetener" won the Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album, while "Thank U, Next" broke several streaming records and produced chart-topping singles like "Thank U, Next" and "7 Rings." Grande's music often blends pop, R&B, and EDM, showcasing her versatility as an artist.

Grande is also known for her philanthropic efforts, particularly following the Manchester Arena bombing in 2017, which occurred during her "Dangerous Woman Tour." She organized the One Love Manchester benefit concert to raise funds for the victims and their families, demonstrating her commitment to using her platform for good.

In addition to her music career, Grande has continued to act in television and film, and she remains a prominent figure in pop culture. Her influence extends beyond music, as she is also recognized for her distinct fashion sense and social media presence.

fields.title: Rihanna
fields.content:
Date of Birth: February 20, 1988
Place of Birth: Saint Michael, Barbados
Occupation: Singer, Actress, Fashion Designer, Businesswoman
Biography:
Robyn Rihanna Fenty was born in Saint Michael, Barbados, and raised in Bridgetown. She was discovered by American record producer Evan Rogers who invited her to the United States to record demo tapes. Rihanna signed with Def Jam Recordings after auditioning for then-president Jay-Z, launching her career in the music industry.

Her debut album, "Music of the Sun" (2005), and its follow-up, "A Girl Like Me" (2006), brought early success with singles like "Pon de Replay" and "SOS." However, it was her third album, "Good Girl Gone Bad" (2007), that catapulted her to international fame, featuring the hit single "Umbrella," which won a Grammy Award and established her as a global pop icon.

Rihanna continued to release successful albums, including "Rated R" (2009), "Loud" (2010), "Talk That Talk" (2011), and "Unapologetic" (2012), which produced chart-topping hits such as "Rude Boy," "Only Girl (In the World)," "We Found Love," and "Diamonds." Her eighth studio album, "Anti" (2016), showcased her versatility and artistic growth, receiving critical acclaim and producing hits like "Work."

Beyond music, Rihanna has made significant strides in fashion and business. She launched her Fenty Beauty cosmetics line in 2017, which was praised for its inclusivity in offering a wide range of skin tones. In 2019, she expanded her brand with the luxury fashion house Fenty under LVMH, making her the first woman of color to head a brand under the luxury group.

Rihanna has also pursued acting, appearing in films such as "Battleship" (2012), "Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets" (2017), and "Ocean's 8" (2018). Known for her philanthropic efforts, she founded the Clara Lionel Foundation, which supports education and emergency response programs worldwide.

fields.title: Shakira
fields.content:
Date of Birth: February 2, 1977
Place of Birth: Barranquilla, Colombia
Occupation: Singer, Songwriter, Dancer, Record Producer, Philanthropist
Biography:
Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll was born in Barranquilla, Colombia, and showed a natural talent for music from a young age. She wrote her first song at eight and signed her first record deal at thirteen. Her early albums, "Magia" (1990) and "Peligro" (1993), did not achieve commercial success, but her breakthrough came with "Pies Descalzos" (1995) and "Dónde Están los Ladrones?" (1998), which established her as a prominent figure in Latin music.

Shakira's international success was solidified with her fifth album, "Laundry Service" (2001), which included hit singles like "Whenever, Wherever" and "Underneath Your Clothes." Her unique blend of Latin, rock, and pop music, along with her distinctive voice and hip-shaking dance moves, earned her widespread acclaim.

She continued to release successful albums, including "Fijación Oral, Vol. 1" (2005), "Oral Fixation, Vol. 2" (2005), "She Wolf" (2009), and "Sale el Sol" (2010). Hits like "Hips Don't Lie," "Waka Waka (This Time for Africa)," and "Chantaje" further cemented her status as a global superstar. Shakira's eleventh studio album, "El Dorado" (2017), won the Grammy Award for Best Latin Pop Album.

In addition to her music career, Shakira is known for her philanthropic work. She founded the Barefoot Foundation (Pies Descalzos Foundation), which focuses on providing quality education for underprivileged children in Colombia. She has also served as a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador since 2003.

Shakira's influence extends beyond music and philanthropy; she has served as a coach on the television show "The Voice" and performed at major events such as the FIFA World Cup and the Super Bowl halftime show. Her diverse talents and dedication to humanitarian causes make her one of the most influential artists of her generation.

fields.title: Anastasia Ashley
fields.content:
Date of Birth: February 10, 1987
Place of Birth: San Clemente, California, USA
Occupation: Professional Surfer, Model
Biography:
Anastasia Electra Ashley was born in San Clemente, California, and began surfing at the age of five. By the age of six, she had won her first competition using a run-down board she found in a trash can outside her house. Her early passion and dedication to the sport quickly paid off, and she became a professional surfer by the age of 16.

Ashley has won numerous titles and accolades throughout her career, including the 2003 Triple Crown Rookie of the Year award, the 2004 National Scholastic Surfing Association (NSSA) Championship, and the Professional Surfing Tour of America (PSTA) Championship. Known for her powerful and aggressive style, she has competed in various prestigious surfing events around the world.

In addition to her surfing career, Ashley has gained fame as a model and media personality. She has appeared in magazines such as Sports Illustrated, Maxim, and FHM, and has been featured on television programs like "Hell’s Kitchen" and "Stewart's & Hamiltons." Her striking looks and athletic prowess have made her a popular figure both within and outside the surfing community.

Ashley is also involved in various entrepreneurial ventures and philanthropic activities. She has launched her own line of jewelry and swimwear and is an advocate for ocean conservation and environmental sustainability. She frequently uses her platform to raise awareness about the importance of protecting marine ecosystems and reducing plastic pollution.

Balancing her professional surfing career with modeling and activism, Anastasia Ashley continues to inspire and influence many with her dynamic and multifaceted approach to life.

fields.title: Madonna Louise Ciccone
fields.content:
Date of Birth: August 16, 1958
Place of Birth: Bay City, Michigan, USA
Occupation: Singer, Songwriter, Actress, Businesswoman
Biography:
Madonna Louise Ciccone, known mononymously as Madonna, was born in Bay City, Michigan, and raised in Rochester Hills. She moved to New York City in 1978 to pursue a career in modern dance, but soon transitioned to singing and songwriting. Her early years in New York were marked by struggle, but she quickly rose to prominence with the release of her self-titled debut album in 1983.

Madonna's innovative approach to music, fashion, and performance quickly made her a cultural icon. Her second album, "Like a Virgin" (1984), solidified her status as the "Queen of Pop" with hits like "Material Girl" and the title track. She continued to push boundaries with her music videos and stage performances, often sparking controversy and debate.

Throughout the 1980s and 1990s, Madonna released a series of successful albums, including "True Blue" (1986), "Like a Prayer" (1989), "Erotica" (1992), and "Ray of Light" (1998). Her ability to reinvent herself and stay relevant in the ever-changing music industry has been a key factor in her enduring success. Songs like "Vogue," "La Isla Bonita," and "Frozen" are just a few examples of her vast and diverse discography.

In addition to her music career, Madonna has ventured into acting, with notable roles in films such as "Desperately Seeking Susan" (1985), "Evita" (1996), for which she won a Golden Globe, and "A League of Their Own" (1992). She has also directed films, written children's books, and founded the entertainment company Maverick.

Madonna is known for her activism and philanthropic efforts, particularly in the areas of HIV/AIDS research and education. She founded the charity Raising Malawi in 2006 to help orphans and vulnerable children in Malawi. Her influence extends beyond music and entertainment, as she continues to be a powerful advocate for social and political causes.

fields.title: Maria Yuryevna Sharapova
fields.content:
Date of Birth: April 19, 1987
Place of Birth: Nyagan, Russia
Occupation: Professional Tennis Player (Retired), Businesswoman
Biography:
Maria Yuryevna Sharapova was born in Nyagan, Russia, and moved to Sochi at a young age. Her tennis talent was evident early on, and she moved to the United States with her father at the age of seven to train at the Nick Bollettieri Tennis Academy in Florida. Sharapova turned professional in 2001 at the age of 14.

She burst onto the international scene in 2004 when she won Wimbledon at the age of 17, defeating Serena Williams in the final. This victory marked the beginning of a successful career that included five Grand Slam titles: Wimbledon (2004), US Open (2006), Australian Open (2008), and two French Open titles (2012, 2014).

Sharapova was known for her powerful serve, fierce competitiveness, and mental toughness on the court. She achieved the World No. 1 ranking for the first time in 2005 and held the position multiple times throughout her career. Despite facing numerous injuries and a suspension in 2016 for a doping violation, she made successful comebacks, demonstrating her resilience and determination.

Off the court, Sharapova has been a successful businesswoman. She launched her candy line, Sugarpova, in 2012, which has since expanded into a global brand. She has also been involved in various endorsement deals with major companies like Nike, Porsche, and Head, making her one of the highest-paid female athletes in the world.

Sharapova retired from professional tennis in 2020, leaving behind a legacy as one of the sport's greatest champions. She continues to be involved in business ventures and philanthropic activities, including her foundation, which supports children around the world in achieving their dreams through education and sports.

fields.title: Tom Brady
fields.content:
Date of Birth: August 3, 1977
Place of Birth: San Mateo, California, USA
Occupation: Professional Football Player (Retired), Businessman
Biography:
Thomas Edward Patrick Brady Jr. was born in San Mateo, California, and grew up a passionate football fan. He attended the University of Michigan, where he played college football for the Wolverines. Despite a relatively modest college career, Brady was selected by the New England Patriots in the sixth round of the 2000 NFL Draft.

Brady's NFL career is nothing short of legendary. As the starting quarterback for the Patriots, he led the team to six Super Bowl victories (XXXVI, XXXVIII, XXXIX, XLIX, LI, and LIII) and earned four Super Bowl MVP awards. Known for his exceptional leadership, precision, and poise under pressure, Brady is widely regarded as one of the greatest quarterbacks of all time.

In 2020, Brady signed with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and led the team to victory in Super Bowl LV, securing his seventh championship. His unprecedented success on the field is complemented by numerous records, including the most career touchdown passes and the most career passing yards in NFL history.

Off the field, Brady is a successful entrepreneur and philanthropist. He co-founded the wellness brand TB12, which promotes a holistic approach to health and athletic performance. He is also involved in various business ventures, including his own media company, 199 Productions, and has been an ambassador for brands like Under Armour, Aston Martin, and UGG.

Brady's dedication to his craft, longevity, and consistent performance have set a standard of excellence in professional sports. He remains an influential figure, inspiring future generations of athletes with his work ethic, discipline, and passion for the game.

fields.title: Leonardo DiCaprio
fields.content:
Date of Birth: November 11, 1974
Place of Birth: Los Angeles, California, USA
Occupation: Actor, Producer, Environmental Activist
Biography:
Leonardo Wilhelm DiCaprio was born in Los Angeles, California, and began his acting career at a young age. He appeared in television commercials and educational films before landing recurring roles in TV series like "Growing Pains" and "Parenthood." His breakout film role came in "This Boy's Life" (1993), where he starred opposite Robert De Niro.

DiCaprio's performance in "What's Eating Gilbert Grape" (1993) earned him his first Academy Award nomination. He gained international fame with roles in "Romeo + Juliet" (1996) and "Titanic" (1997), the latter of which became one of the highest-grossing films of all time and established him as a global heartthrob.

Throughout his career, DiCaprio has consistently chosen challenging and diverse roles in films such as "The Beach" (2000), "Catch Me If You Can" (2002), "Gangs of New York" (2002), "The Aviator" (2004), "Blood Diamond" (2006), and "Inception" (2010). He has collaborated frequently with renowned directors like Martin Scorsese, starring in films like "The Departed" (2006), "Shutter Island" (2010), and "The Wolf of Wall Street" (2013).

In 2016, DiCaprio won his first Academy Award for Best Actor for his role in "The Revenant" (2015). He continued to deliver acclaimed performances in films like "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" (2019), for which he received another Oscar nomination.

Beyond acting, DiCaprio is a dedicated environmental activist. He founded the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation in 1998, which focuses on global conservation efforts, climate change, and protecting biodiversity. He has produced several environmental documentaries, including "The 11th Hour" (2007), "Before the Flood" (2016), and "Ice on Fire" (2019).

DiCaprio's commitment to his craft and his activism has made him one of the most respected figures in Hollywood. His influence extends beyond cinema, as he continues to advocate for critical environmental issues and support various philanthropic causes.
